brief_summary.textblock:
This project evaluates the effectiveness of different aspects of a program to assist type 2
      diabetes patients with dietary changes. It evaluates the effectiveness of Personalized
      Self-Management Training and Community Resources support, using a randomized design. This
      study will also evaluate what percent of patients are willing to participate in such a
      program, and what percent of primary care physicians are willing to recommend it to their
      patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Type 2 diabetes

          -  Diagnosed for at least one year

          -  Patient of a primary care provider

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  No telephone

          -  Not speaking English

reference.citation: Glasgow RE, La Chance PA, Toobert DJ, Brown J, Hampson SE, Riddle MC. Long-term effects and costs of brief behavioural dietary intervention for patients with diabetes delivered from the medical office. Patient Educ Couns. 1997 Nov;32(3):175-84.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment
